description: Difference array of Motzkin numbers A001006 read by antidiagonals.
comments: Row sums of odd rows (e.g. 4 = 1+1+2 for 3rd row) equal the Motzkin number of next row. Row sums of even rows equal the Motzkin number of the next row - n!/((n/2)!((n/2)+1)!) (i.e. A001006(n) - A000108(n/2) where A000108 are the Catalan numbers). - _Gerald McGarvey_, Dec 05 2004
links: F. R. Bernhart, Catalan, Motzkin and Riordan numbers, Discr. Math., 204 (1999), 73-112.
mathematica: max = 12; A001006 = CoefficientList[ Series[ (1-x-(1-2x-3x^2)^(1/2))/(2x^2), {x, 0, max}], x] ; row[0] = A001006; row[n_] := Differences[A001006, n]; Flatten[ Table[ row[n-k][[k]], {n, 1, max}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 12 2012, from formula *)
crossrefs: Top row is A001006, leading diagonals give A000108 (interspersed with 0's), A000108 doubled up, A059348.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 27 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Feb 16 2001
